history.content: I've asked this before, and I'm fairly sure you can't backdate a mezzanine class. If you're an undergrad, you have to enroll in the 1xx version, and you can't backdate a 1xx-level class for grad units.

I've asked this before, and I'm fairly sure you can't backdate a mezzanine class. If you're an undergrad, you have to enroll in the 100 version, and you can't backdate a 100-level class for grad units.
I've asked this before, and I'm fairly sure you can't backdate a mezzanine class.

children.subject: Classes that are listed as 1xx and 2xx at the same time, like 182/282A. If you search "mezzanine" on this Piazza you'll probably find others asking the same question.

Hi! Congrats on getting into the master's! This is unrelated to your post but I'm a junior hoping to apply to the 5th Year Masters program as well. If you're open I'd really appreciate a chance to chat about the process!

history.content:
<md>I got accepted into the 5th Year Masters Program and I am a senior currently taking CS 182. I was wondering if it would be possible for me to use the apply the units that I received from taking CS 182 towards my Masters Program requirements? The only caveat I have in mind is that CS 182 is not precisely the same as CS 282A. I am basing this idea off of the paragraph below, taken from the masters program website:

**NOTE:** Berkeley undergraduates who take graduate course work during their last undergraduate semester may petition to backdate graduate standing in order to receive graduate credit for that course work. Graduate standing may be backdated for only **one course**, and students may petition for credit only for coursework that was not previously used to satisfy requirements for another degree and/or the honors program at Berkeley or at any other institution.</md>
history.subject: Backdating CS182 for 5th Year Masters
